item.title: Eating the springbok's tongue-tip
item.summary: The tip of the tongue of the Springbok is not eaten by children. In the Katkop dialect, by Díä!kwãin (L V.-25. 6025-6030). When the springbok's tongue-tip is eaten, the person stumbles over a stone and stubs his or her toe.
item.comments: 1) This story is found in Book V-25
item.author: Dia!kwain (David Hoesar) (V)
